summary: A victim impact statement submitted to Judge Alison J. Nathan by a law firm on behalf of a victim, opposing Ghislaine Maxwell's renewed motion for bail. The statement details the victim's personal abuse by Maxwell, characterizes Maxwell as a psychopath and flight risk, and urges the court to keep her incarcerated until trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case, accused of sexually abusing the author as a child and procuring girls for Jeffrey Epstein to abuse. The statement argues she is a psychopath and a flight risk.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The letter is addressed to her, requesting she deny Maxwell's bail motion.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the person for whom Maxwell allegedly procured girls to abuse. Implicitly central to the criminal scheme.

connections.description: Maxwell is accused of playing a central role in procuring girls for Epstein to abuse, indicating a collaborative criminal relationship.

events.title: Submission of Victim Impact Statement
events.description: A victim submits a formal statement to Judge Nathan opposing Ghislaine Maxwell's renewed motion for bail, detailing her abuse and arguing Maxwell is a flight risk.

events.title: Maxwell's Renewed Bail Motion
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell has filed a renewed motion seeking release on bail pending her trial, which this document opposes.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: A victim of Ghislaine Maxwell provides a first-person account, stating Maxwell sexually abused her as a child.
The victim characterizes Maxwell as a psychopath who is charming, manipulative, lacks empathy and remorse, and is a significant flight risk.
The statement accuses Maxwell of playing a central role in procuring girls for Jeffrey Epstein to abuse.
The document argues Maxwell has lived a parasitic, lavish lifestyle funded by Epstein and others, and her primary concern is her own welfare.
The victim implores the court to deny bail, fearing Maxwell will flee the country and potentially abuse more children if released.
